app module¶

class app.User(id, username, password)[source]¶

Bases: UserMixin

Represents a user for Flask-Login.

id¶

The unique ID of the user.

Type:

str

username¶

The username of the user.

Type:

str

password¶

The hashed password of the user.

Type:

str

app.api_add_goods()[source]¶

API to add new goods to the inventory.

Request JSON: - name (str): Name of the product. - category (str): Category of the product. - price_per_item (float): Price per item of the product. - description (str): Description of the product. - stock_count (int): Quantity of the product in stock.

Returns:

JSON object with details of the added goods or an error message.

Return type:

Response

Request JSON: - product_id (int): ID of the product to add.

Returns:

JSON object with success message or error details.

Return type:

Response

app.api_charge_wallet(username, amount)[source]¶

Charges a specified amount to a customer’s wallet.

Parameters:

  • amount (str) – The amount to charge.

Returns:

JSON message indicating success or failure.

Return type:

Response

app.api_deduct_goods(name, category, quantity)[source]¶

API to deduct a quantity from an item’s stock in the inventory.

Parameters:

  • category (str) – Category of the product.

  • quantity (int) – Quantity to deduct from stock.

Returns:

JSON object with success message or error details.

Response

app.api_make_sale()[source]¶

API to process a sale by deducting customer funds and inventory stock.

Request JSON: - username (str): Username of the customer making the purchase. - good_name (str): Name of the product being purchased. - category (str): Category of the product. - quantity (int): Quantity of the product being purchased.

Returns:

JSON object indicating success or error details.

Return type:

Response

review_id (int) – ID of the review to moderate.

Returns:

JSON object with success message or error details.

Response

app.api_register_customer()[source]¶

Registers a new customer in the database.

Request JSON: - full_name (str) - username (str) - password (str) - age (int) - address (str) - gender (str) - marital_status (str) - wallet (float)

Returns:

JSON object of the registered customer or error message.

Return type:

Response

app.api_submit_review()[source]¶

API to submit a review for a product. Only authenticated users can submit reviews.

Request JSON: - product_name (str): Name of the product being reviewed. - username (str): Username of the customer submitting the review. - rating (int): Rating for the product (1-5). - comment (str): Optional comment for the review.

Returns:

JSON object with success message or error details.

Return type:

Response

app.api_update_goods()[source]¶

API to update fields of an item in the inventory.

Returns:

JSON message indicating success or failure.

Response

app.api_update_review(review_id)[source]¶

API to update an existing review. Only the review owner can update the review.

Request JSON: - rating (int): New rating for the product (1-5). - comment (str): Updated comment for the review.

Parameters:

review_id (int) – ID of the review to update.

Returns:

JSON object with success message or error details.

Return type:

Response

app.load_user(user_id)[source]¶

This function is called to load a user by their ID during a session.

Parameters:

user_id (str) – The unique ID of the user.

Returns:

The User object if the user exists, otherwise None.

Return type:

User

app.login()[source]¶

Logs in a user by validating their username and password.

Request JSON: - username (str): The username of the user. - password (str): The plaintext password of the user.

Logic: - Fetch the user from the database using the provided username. - Compare the provided password with the stored hashed password. - If valid, log the user in and return a success message. - If invalid, return an error message.

Returns:

A JSON response with a success or error message.

Return type:

Response

app.logout()[source]¶

Logs out the currently logged-in user.

Logic: - Ends the user session using Flask-Login’s logout_user function. - Returns a success message indicating the user has been logged out.

Returns:

A JSON response confirming the logout.

Return type:

Response
